block.p: EDDIE DELAHOUSSAYE became the 14th jockey in racing history to win 5,000 races when he captured yesterday's fifth race at Santa Anita on Ackler. BILL SHOEMAKER, LAFFIT PINCAY JR., ANGEL CORDERO JR. and JORGE VELASQUEZ are among the other riders who have accumulated 5,000 victories. Shoemaker is the career leader with 8,833.

"This is a great personal goal for me," Delahoussaye said. "Ten years ago, I was happy to win 3,000, then I got 4,000, and I didn't think it could get better. Maybe I'm just getting better as I get older.'

EDDIE DELAHOUSSAYE became the 14th jockey in racing history to win 5,000 races when he captured yesterday's fifth race at Santa Anita on Ackler. BILL SHOEMAKER, LAFFIT PINCAY JR., ANGEL CORDERO JR. and JORGE VELASQUEZ are among the other riders who have accumulated 5,000 victories. Shoemaker is the career leader with 8,833.

"This is a great personal goal for me," Delahoussaye said. "Ten years ago, I was happy to win 3,000, then I got 4,000, and I didn't think it could get better. Maybe I'm just getting better as I get older.'
Delahoussaye finished second to KENT DESORMEAUX in voting for champion jockey for 1992. Delahoussaye is one of five riders, including STEVE CAUTHEN, on the ballot for this year's Hall of Fame voting.
